response:
The clinical presentation of a young female with subacute, multifocal inflammatory lesions (optic neuritis, cerebellar syndrome, myelitis) is the hallmark of inflammatory demyelinating disease. Multiple Sclerosis is the most likely diagnosis. NMOSD and MOGAD are important differentials given the optic-spinal distribution.

differential_diagnosis = ["Multiple Sclerosis", "Neuromyelitis Optica Spectrum Disorder (NMOSD)", "MOG Antibody Disease (MOGAD)", "Neurosarcoidosis", "Systemic Lupus Erythematosus", "Behcet's Disease", "Acute Disseminated Encephalomyelitis (ADEM)"]
